revised_title: Effects of Impact, Vibratory Action, and Load Changes on Wrought-Iron Girders
tldr: The author conducts experiments to determine the effects of impact, vibratory action, and long-term load changes on wrought-iron girders. The results show that girders of ordinary construction are not safe when subjected to violent disturbances equivalent to one-third the weight that would break them, but they exhibit great resilience when subjected to one-fourth the load.
